DataElement.preferredName: Image Exam Not Completed Medical Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical reason the imaging exam was not initiated, performed or completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Exam Not Completed Medical Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An medical explanation why any imaging event did not come to an expected conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Medical; relating to the study or practice of medicine.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Relating to the study or practice of medicine.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/28/10 DEC associated with revised VD 3134838v for Image Quality CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping to describe a medical reason why an imaging exam was not initiated, performed or completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.": Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An irrational fear of being in a confined space.

Concepts.definition: An irrational fear of being in a confined space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.: The outcome of a laboratory test.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
The outcome of a laboratory test.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
